description.narrative: The Project is expected to have a high development impact in the following areas: 1. Supporting MSME Sector Development: The Project will help the Bank extend its MSMEs reach, an under-served segment in Tanzania. 2. Enhancing Access to Finance for Farmers: The Project, by helping the Bank grow its agri lending portfolio through the use of warehouse receipts (WHR) as collateral, will improve availability of credit for farmers, promote employment and support growth.

The proposed engagement with National Microfinance Bank (NMB) is aligned to IFCs strategy for the African financial sector. The project aims at helping NMB expand its reach in Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) finance and in commodity agri finance. The Project is supported by the IDA18 IFC-MIGA Private Sector Windows Local Currency Facility (PSW LCF), which was created by the Word Bank Group to catalyze private sector investment in IDA countries, with a focus on fragile and conflict-affected states, by providing financing in local currency for high impact projects where local currency solutions are underdeveloped or missing. PSW LCF support to this Project will enable IFC to provide the long-term local currency financing needed to unlock financing for MSMEs and agribusinesses in Tanzania.

mailing-address.narrative: National Microfinance Bank Mrs. Ineke Bussemaker Chief Executive Officer +255 222 322 000 info@nmbtz.com Ohio Street/Ali Hassan Mwinyi Road, P.O Box 9213, Dar es Salaam, Tanzania

name.narrative: The Bank is headquartered in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and has 190 branches across Tanzania.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

title.narrative: Summary of Investment Information - Anticipated Impact Measurement & Monitoring (AIMM) Assessment and Main Environmental & Social Risks and Impacts of the Project
